website_summaries.verdict: Outdoor cooking has never been easier, but the trade-off is the unit's exterior components that come with a few issues.
pros: Powerful dual 20,000-BTU burners, quick cooking capabilities, and matchless ignition
Stainless steel drip train and and carrying handle
cons: A few exterior quality concerns: sharp edges, sub-par rivets, flimsy lid latch

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality From Rushed Manufacture
customer_reviews.text: Update: The second stove was not as unbalanced, bust still did not sit flat. It looked like it had been dropped on one corner as it was dented. They box came with a hole punctured in the top and was in the packaging upside down. It seemed like it had been returned before and had been sold to me as new. Returned. Original review: My husband explains more in-depth in the video the poor quality of the stove just out of the box, brand new. Poorly made. Trying one more time. We ordered a replacement just in case there this is a small percentage of cases.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn Bobbitt

customer_reviews.title: Ignitor won't work.
customer_reviews.text: Already failed before first use. We were so excited when the stove arrived and we decided to test it to make sure that everything is ok. Well, the excitement died down after trying the stove. We set it up with a gas canister according to the instruction manual and tried to fire it up. The ignitor did not work. No sparks came out of the ignitor to start the fire. We tried several times without success. I have had 2 coleman portable stoves before and their ignitor worked without any issues and those stove with the ignitor lasted more than 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Poms

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST CAMP STOVE I EVER USED!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used my CampChef Everest twice since ordering it a couple months ago. In 55 years of camping my Everest is, hands down, THE best camp stove I ever used. It’s rigged. It’s portable. It’s large enough for two large pots or a full-sized griddle. The 20 btu burners at full power are like afterburners on an F-15! The heat is easily controlled from low-and-slow to getting a large pot boiling in five minutes. This stove is ridiculously easy to use! My wife and I are overjoyed to have this powerful, rugged workhorse for our camping adventures! Always been a Coleman fanatic. CampChef Everest has raised the bar higher than Coleman can see, let alone reach!
customer_reviews.author: Doc H

customer_reviews.title: Failed after only 4 uses!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used it precisely for 4 meals. Now the right burner appears broken. Will not light correctly, flame is very tall and yellow, is much louder than the left burner. It doesn’t matter if one or both burners are on. Must be a valve problem? Maybe Camp Chef support has a recommendation or RMA process they can share. It quite disappointing as I was surprised how hot this thing would get, great for boiling lots of water or cooking large quantities. Happy to move this to a higher rating if this can be resolved quickly and easily.
customer_reviews.author: jmiller

customer_reviews.title: Great concept - poor execution
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this stove and had high hopes based on the specs and other reviews. Used it on one camping trip and have since returned for a refund. Pros - lightweight - looks nice. - nice width. Cons - right burner had a fuel leak which caused frequent blowouts. - due to the leak, pressure to both burners was inconsistent. - unable to determine if a low flame could be achieved or maintained due to leak. When we tried cooking, it cooked too hot. - carrying handle/groove had sharp edges. - igniter only worked one time. Concerns - plastic lid clips and knobs seemed to be of low quality and I'm not sure how long they would last.
customer_reviews.author: Bdub

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!!!
customer_reviews.text: Total piece of junk and does not live up to the camp chef quality standard! The lid on the first one I received was warped and stuck on the drip pan and wouldn’t open. Apparently this is a well known issue. The second one that was overnighted to me (kudos to Amazon) had a loose burner and the regulator leaked propane from the bottle side (black pressure release spring area) . If you’re considering this stove stay far away from this one!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality control issues x2
customer_reviews.text: 2nd stove Dents on bottom, and hook on windscreen won’t align with slot on lid. It looks like the lid was riveted on crooked. Third time’s a charm or give up on company? ———- 1st stove Stove came in fine condition except that the screw securing one of the burners to the stove base must have been way overtightened and snapped. I’d try to source a new screw if I had more time, but also wouldn’t want to void warranty. A bit stuck now with no stove for this weekend’s camping trip. Off to buy a Coleman at the store.
customer_reviews.author: jchizzle

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, broke after a handful of uses.
customer_reviews.text: I had this stove for a month. The day after the amazon return window closed it started leaking gas. Also, the brass attachment between the stove and the propane canister became progressively more difficult to screw in every time. I would not bet my life on this. It's better to buy two fifty dollar stoves, than this hundred dollar hunk of junk. If one breaks, at least the other would keep you eating.
customer_reviews.author: User6183c

customer_reviews.title: Inferior design, poor quatity control, and unreilable.
customer_reviews.text: I tested the unit prior to my trip. The right burner did not function at all right out of the box. The poorly designed plastic latches are riveted to the aluminum. One of the latches had a loose rivet and the latch could spin around. Design should have been a simple metal latch, not plastic. Wasn't this thing tested at the factory ?
customer_reviews.author: O'er the Hill

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Could be perfect and 5 stars if camp chef would pay there workers more so that can take a little more pride in there work. Also spend more on there packing materials. This is my second stove first one came in mail dented and top wouldn’t shut right. Sent it back got the replacement and it seem worse for wear. It works and I need it for upcoming camping trip. For 100.00 I would expect more. Even from Amazon they sent in a box with nothing to keep it tight and compacted for shipping it just got banged around.
customer_reviews.author: Kaui808

customer_reviews.title: The adjustable flame is a big improvement over other stoves
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have a small travel trailer, but mostly cook outside with a propane grill and a camp stove, rather than steam up the inside of the trailer on the trailer's stove. This Camp Chef stove is a replacement for a Coleman stove We've had for years that I've never liked because the flame adjustment was all or nothing. This Camp Chef stove is more expensive, but the flame is adjustable from a simmer to a fast boil.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Webster

customer_reviews.title: A Great Camp Stove
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stove 3 years ago. I've spent just over 100 days out in the wilderness since this purchase using this stove every one of those days. I used it every morning, for lunch and dinner. It served me well. I detected a leak internally, so I replaced it. Paid $99.99 for it this time. I like the metal latch. I understand the new ones have a plastic latch. I hate placement of the gas arm. They can do better for sure. Overall, I bought it again, so that tells you a lot.
customer_reviews.author: HJSV

customer_reviews.title: Best stove I have used
customer_reviews.text: Best stove I have used. Used to have a Coleman stove. Well worth it. Very hot flame when turned up and easy adjustment. Clean and compact. Only issue I see is the gas cylinder connector can be hard to screw into the stove and if it is not screwed all the way then no gas will reach the burners. It needs to be twisted around 10 times to be correctly on. Recommend the manufacturer puts an extension on the tightening bolt for easier use.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Stove looks very nice and solid
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived damaged. Pros: Stove looks very nice and solid. The burners look big and well designed. Cons The packing of this product was simply horrible. When I opened the delivery box, the Camp Chef box showed signs of miss handling and the device inside was damaged as well, because it lacked packing materials to protect the stove. This product is very expensive, compared to other stoves, and it is surprising the lack of care how it was put in a box and delivered.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke second camping trip
customer_reviews.text: Puts out a lot of heat when it works but unfortunately it didn't work for me very long. The second time I used it it left me stranded right in the middle of breakfast. There is no gas pressure I think the regulator broke, it will light but there is only a tiny flame on both burners. Not sure however because customer service wont return my emails and if I call there is over a 60 min wait time. For the price I paid I thought I was getting something that would be reliable for a while, this definitely isn't it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great, while it works
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this stove for less than two months. It’s been great so far, but this morning the regulator sprang a leak and shot a propane fireball 🔥 💥 out the side of the stove. PRO - heat output and flame control - nice grate and cooking surface CON - fragile regulator your have to push hard on to thread and attach - it leaked after <2 months - awkward carrying handle (real missed opportunity) - propane connection port is not sturdy My parents have had the same Coleman propane stove for 20+ years with no issues. The fact that this stove has an issue already is incredibly disappointing, especially at 2x the price.
customer_reviews.author: Payne

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.  Once!!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the look of this stove. The good reviews prompted me to buy it. Basically it’s a use once and toss item. It worked great the first time we used it. Our son heated up chili and some spilled over. We cleaned it well and even blew out all the components with an air compressor as instructed and it never worked right again. Never had the nice flame after that and so it went into the garbage. Cute camp stove but you have to be neat about cooking evidently and be prepared to toss it when it quits providing enough flame to cook anything.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Lusk

customer_reviews.title: Good so far...
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased another camp stove from Amazon and there were major issues with it. I sent it back (Amazon returns are the best...) and purchased this stove. No issues with this stove. While I feel like most table top camp stoves really are flimsy / lower quality materials, this one might be a bit better. The metal feels a little thicker. Gave it a quick test run. Let first try and both burners. Lots of heat. I'll update if I have any issues but its looking good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Andrei

customer_reviews.title: Bad Boy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Mt. Everest Camp Chef. Hooked this baby up today to just check it out before I pack it in my camp gear. Used the Chef Hose to the 5 gallon tank and to the stove. Paired up perfectly. Turn on the gas, opened the burner valve, hit the electronic igniter, and I got flame. Opened the valve all the way up, and oh, what a bad boy. Turned on the other burner and wow. If this stove won't do it for ya, then you better figure another way to cook cause this has more heat than you'll probably ever need, well unless you were using it to do blacksmith work. Totally awesome stove.
customer_reviews.author: Sim

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We took this stove camping for almost two weeks, along with one 10" skillet and a 2 qt. saucepan. I cooked multiple meals on my stove without burning anything. I made spaghetti in the 2 qt saucepan, first browning the meat, then adding all other ingredients. It did not burn on the bottom before the spaghetti was done. The heat control was excellent for that as well as scrambling eggs. I cooked pork chops and spanish rice. All were done to my satisfaction, I would recommend this to anyone who is deciding between this and a Coleman stove. I am glad I chose this one.
customer_reviews.author: cindyjobhunt

customer_reviews.title: A dual 20,000 BTU beast that will also maintain a gentle simmer!
customer_reviews.text: I'd read reviews of other high output propane stoves (Coleman) that did great at medium to high heat settings but would go out repeatedly when you tried to lower them to a simmer. This stove has nearly infinite control from a gentle simmer to a rapid rolling boil. The only minor complaint I have with the stove is the "handle" which is an opening in the metal case of the stove you can place your hand into. It has a non rolled edge that isn't particularly comfortable to grab. This isn't an issue for me because I also purchased the Camp Chef zippered storage bag made of heavy nylon with great handles.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rader

customer_reviews.title: Three sided wind barrier does not work properly.
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality control. The 3 sided wind barrier does not latch on the left side. The locking catch was welded approx 1/2" shorter than where it should be located. The factory tries to tell you it was designed that way, and you just lean the lid on that. Why would the latch mechanism be exactly the same as the right side if it was not meant to latch. Even the picture on the box shows that it should latch properly. "Lean it on it"...(ROTFLMAO) So unless you are ok with a lifetime pain in the *** of the left side falling, don't buy this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Don J.

customer_reviews.title: Came with a few things bent
customer_reviews.text: One of the valve knobs was bent and one of the T hooks that hold up the wind flaps as well. Overall it's a good stove and burners have plenty of BTU's to melt steel. When you first start cooking with it just make sure to start out on the lower end, I burnt up a half pack of bacon in no time. I've read people complaining about the heat adjustment but it's meant to cook outdoors with the wind in mind. I was able to make toast straight off the burner grates if that makes you feel any better.
customer_reviews.author: Colby L. Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Surpassed My Initial Expectations
customer_reviews.text: The Stove just arrived this evening and first glance it surpassed my expectations. I read a few articles comparing camping stoves, and it was stated the cons to this stove was it is flimsy with sharp edges, otherwise it surpassed many other stoves that had less BTU's and were more expensive. I find this stove to be no more flimsy or anymore sharp edges than other stoves I've owned and I have owned 3 of them in the last 30 years. I find it to be actually quite nice. I will update this review as we use it. We camp at least a week out of each summer month so it'll be put through its paces.
customer_reviews.author: JLC

customer_reviews.title: Product defective out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I just oped the new Everest stove and noticed that the two wind flaps are different. The lid of the stove needs to be bent in order for the connecting tabs on the wind flaps to engage the lid. The two tabs on the wind flaps are spaced about 1/4" - 1/2" differently, so it's impossible to attach both without bending the lid of the stove itself. Very disappointed that there is such a blatant manufacturing defect that was not caught before being shipped to a customer.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Dolen

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this stove!! Terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research online before buying this stove, was very excited based on reviews. Boy was I wrong! This stove is cheaply built, I had to use a screwdriver to pry it open, it does not sit level, the clasps do not work, and there is no carrying handle (despite description saying otherwise). Another user has posted a video showing he had the exact same problem, so this is not a one-off issue. Do not buy this stove.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin J Riley

customer_reviews.title: Quality control issues
customer_reviews.text: Grill wobbles, does not sit flat. One side of wind shield door hard to get into slot (will likely break). Picked it up from the inset handle, and that bent. Plastic latches don't seem very durable, and while I'm at it, the Camp Chef badge on front of stove was riveted on Not level. I'd say you get what you pay for, but this was $100. I expected a little finer quality. It does look nice, if you don't open it up.... Unfortunately I also purchased the storage bag, so I'm invested. I don't feel like boxing up and returning.
customer_reviews.author: Big Martini

customer_reviews.title: Best Stove out there.
customer_reviews.text: This stove was the star of the show at Joshua Tree N.P. camping trip. I've been camping for over 40 years, this is the one you want.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: No one is taking this up Everest
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy junk. Arrived with a bent burner knob. Was not due to improper packaging. Has a propane leak so we can't leave the bottle attached or full bottle is empty by morning. Propane attachment is even more flimsy than the rest of stove. Igniter is dead after 4th use. Rust is starting everywhere after only 10 days. Is anyone not producing throwaway junk anymore?
customer_reviews.author: Person is Me

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with quality being much better than the competition.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect condition out of the box, noticeably higher quality than the best Coleman models, great recessed handle in the bottom, wider than most cooking surface fits some larger grill plates, fired up first click of the starting button. This thing puts out MUCH more heat than the Colemans, I can’t imagine ever using the high setting. The knobs have good flame control unlike lots of the competition. I tested fuel consumption with both burners on Medium heat and in 30 minutes I burned about 5 oz. of a 1 lb. (16 oz. bottle), so I’m guessing ~1.5 hours out of a small bottle at this setting, estimating 3 hours on the lowest setting or with just one burner.
customer_reviews.author: If it's Prime, I will buy it.

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to go into my Hurricane Kit and had it for a month and Hurricane Imra became a reality September 11, 3017. Broke it out and used it several times to cook breakfast. Works awesome. Burnt the crap out of some bacon the first timer and figured out that propane is hot! After a short learning period and some more bacon had it down pat and everyone had a couple great breakfasts. Also bought the adapter hose to run the 20 gallon tanks and that works quite well also.
customer_reviews.author: James W Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great camp stove
customer_reviews.text: This is the first camp stove I have ever owned. I have camped with friends who have a Coleman stove and I have to say I really like the Camp Chef stove better. The burner controls work great, you can turn the flame down low enough to simmer or high enough to singe your eyebrows.
customer_reviews.author: L2B

customer_reviews.title: Not %100 satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this stove on two outings now. Not a bad performer. I bought this stove to cook food, and it functions great. I enjoy using it. The heat, range of adjustment is great. BUT, I do have a couple of issues. The igniter quit on the last outing. No convenient way to carry it. It really needs leveling feet. The lid latches are cheap plastic hooks, but seem to work ok, for now. This is a great stove in the $70 to $80 range.
customer_reviews.author: john boyce

customer_reviews.title: If you camp, you need this stove.
customer_reviews.text: This is the most powerful little stove I've ever had. It's a beast. Uses the 1lb propane tanks pretty quickly, but you can also whip up a 4 course meal with ease with that tank. I used it to heat a griddle on my last camping trip....it was perfect. I used it to boil water for a hot shower. Perfect. Make coffee? Perfect. And it all tucked away nicely into my new Grub Hub camp kitchen. I will buy this same stove again if anything ever happens to the first one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these and one usually has a double burner griddle on it for main course and the other stove usually has two pots for side dishes. They put out so much flame that I didn't have a need to ever use it at full blast - though i like to know they "go to 11" if i want it. People who see my set up tell me they think I'm a total pro! It's all in the equipment :) Note: I use All-Clad griddles on the stove and they fit perfectly - see attached pictures.
customer_reviews.author: anonomous

customer_reviews.title: Great, love it.
customer_reviews.text: just best camp stove so far ever. Wish side burners had better wings to shield wind but it's the same with everyone on that. They need a little outer shield that slides down on the wings so they touch the table all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea L

customer_reviews.title: Little pricey but so rediculously worth it
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a birthday gift and am more than thrilled. It provides more than enough power to do any and all cooking, it boiled a pot of water for me in less than two minutes. A lot of cooking space so there's no juggling pans to make them both fit. The ignition switch worked without fail and it was easy to set up. Additionally the wind guard actually locks into place on the top via metal tabs. It also has a handle on the underside that isn't shown in any of the pictures. Been camping all my life and this is the best camp stove of this type that I've encountered. Wouldn't suggest any other product.
customer_reviews.author: CirceTrov

customer_reviews.title: Good but newer model has metal latches
customer_reviews.text: We ended up returning this one but bought the same brand, the newer model of the same stove. It has metal latches. We read reviews about the plastic ones breaking so we were happy to find the newer model at the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Tat

customer_reviews.title: A burner fell apart after 14 months
customer_reviews.text: My rating for the Camp Chef Everest stove would have been 5 stars until one of the burners fell apart after 14 months. The manufacture warranty ran out after 1 year so it was on me to buy the replacement burner for $25 with shipping. Camp Chef's customer service was very good and the replacement burner was fairly easy to install. I had higher expectations for the Camp Chef Everest stove, especially with the high ratings it received and the amount of care / maintenance I put into things I own. I am happy to have 2 burners again. I will bump my review to 4 stars if I have no more issues come fall.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about receiving a damaged stove based on reviews from others. I'm happy to say my stove arrived in perfect condition cosmetically. I have not tried cooking with it yet since it only arrived today. When I do some cooking on it, I will update this review. For our extended camp/travel plans, this is going to be our main cooking option getting near daily use. I chose this one because of the high BTU output and good reviews for heat control and overall function. See my unboxing video to get a look.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable stove, high heat output, large enough to accommodate family size pots.
customer_reviews.text: A great stove for car camping. At altitude, I need more power than the classic Coleman stoves (10K BTU) provide. This stove is 20K BTUs. That's enough power for my uses. I have two. The oldest is 2 yrs, never had a problem with it. We use it with an external hose and propane tank, as it will burn through the small 1 lb propane tanks pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Strong heat output
customer_reviews.text: The Camp Chef Everest 2 Burner stove seems very nice. We just received it in the mail and right out of the box there is no notable damage. A lot of other reviews stated their stove had dents and scratches, but mine did not. Looks brand new. Heat output is very strong. The flame is blue and not yellow/orange. Boiled a small pot of water in less than 4 mins. We’re excited to take it camping and give it a try! I will update review once we take it camping.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: It’s great!!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s great! I was worried from reviews that the flame would just be raging and uncontrollable but it’s not. It works very well on high, med and low. The high really is high! Boiled water in like 2 mins on the river this morning - the igniter is soo nice and works well! The walls work well too!
customer_reviews.author: KLove

customer_reviews.title: Bad ignitor
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the stove on Aug 1. Used twice and then next time out, the stove ignitor did not ignite. Camp Chef via email told me to unscrew the ignitor and screw in a new ignitor. I spent $88 for the stove, $25 + for the bag and $25 + for the hose and now I have to spend another $15 for a stove ignitor for a stove less than 1 month old?
customer_reviews.author: Mr Ron

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed gas connector and access hole don't line up
customer_reviews.text: I really disliked that the Everest camp stove is so poorly constructed that I cannot fit the gas line to the stove. I would have to cut the side of the chassis to be able to access the gas line. My advice is if you have an older camp stove that works, hang onto it.
customer_reviews.author: G. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Workes great
customer_reviews.text: First I must note I got mine used. So since it was used there where some issues, the right wind shield was bent and dose not line up right to be able to use it. But I now just use it as a utensil holder, and the whole thing has a bit of a twist so there is a slight wobble. But again i bought it used, With that said the bunners are incredibly awesome, easy to fine tune, and crank them up on high can boil over a gal of cold water in less than 5 min, overall I am very happy with this and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Out of the 8 base camp stoves I have bought, both propane and gas, this is the best one i have had.
customer_reviews.text: I wait till I have used an item for a while before I review it. In this case I used it on several trips during the last two years. This is the best simmering stove I have found since my first childhood stove I bought 48 years ago. But if I decide to cook a large low country boil for 10 people, just turn up the heat if it boiling a large pot in not time.
customer_reviews.author: Scruffy

customer_reviews.title: but it worked great. It boiled water quickly on what estimated to ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once so this is just an initial report, but it worked great. It boiled water quickly on what estimated to be a medium setting and I had enough control over the heat to make some pancakes without burning them. My only criticism, and this applies to most camping stoves I see, is that there doesn't seem to be any markings on the knobs to indicate the flame level such that I can set it to the same (or approximately the same) level every time. But, that's a minor gripe.
customer_reviews.author: EMF

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Good stove. Only problem is that the controls are "loose" when turned down low. When you turn them down to lower settings the flame jumps up when you take your hand off the knob. Makes it hard to cook on a low setting. The stove is hotter than a regular Coleman camp stove which makes it easier to get the skillet really hot for frying fish, etc. I prefer it over the Coleman stove.
customer_reviews.author: underpaid

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Use it in my overland rig, nice device, nothing to add, it just works. I installed it permanently on a sliding deck. The funny thing is when I disassemble it one of screws has been filled by metal from the factory screwdriver which was broken during assembling on factory. It's not a problem for me, I used dremel-like tool to make a place to use other type of screwdriver. So, disassembling and assembling were done. It was needed to install it properly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Versatile camp stove
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little camp stove, lightweight and easily portable yet puts out a lot of heat and can accommodate most pots or pans. It even fits my cast iron griddle perfectly. No complaints whatsoever. I was able to cook as hot or as low as I needed. Burners light easily and knobs work well for flame control. Boiled water in my kettle quickly yet can also cooks pancakes on low without burning them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sadly it failed
customer_reviews.text: This would have been a great stove if the attachment to the propane worked. We’ve used it once, one time and the propane attachment stopped working. So sad, I had such high hopes for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Bgirl

customer_reviews.title: Broken Burner, Poor QC
customer_reviews.text: Opened the box and a washer and a broken off screw fell out. Not a good sign to say the least. Took the packaging material off to inspect the unit and discovered that one of the screws which fastens the burner to the bottom of the unit was missing. Upon closer inspection, I noticed that the hole on the burner end was not even drilled through and suspect that this is the reason the screw broke off when they tried to install it. The rest of stove was decently built, but quality control should have caught this issue before shipment. I am returning this unit to the seller and will be buying a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Ordained Prepper

customer_reviews.title: Hot but cheap
customer_reviews.text: This stove is easy to use and it is very hot, but it stopped working on the second use. I didnt even get through the whole propane tank.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a BEAST
customer_reviews.text: I hate cooking inside my brand new RV, so i bought this stove and also a second stove by coleman since coleman had a grill on the side however this stove wins hands down over coleman. Coleman will burn your food if u not watching even on the lowest setting. Camp chef you can adjust your flame to very low or super dooper hot. This stove will not dissapoint you.
customer_reviews.author: IMRAN S.

customer_reviews.title: Best camping stove!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I do a lot of camping and love to throwdown on the meals. I don't know if our stove before was just that terrible, but the campchef stove was life changing when it comes to camping cooking life. Haven't had any issues to report. Definitely a must have for the camping gear!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Dangerously expensive!! Beware
customer_reviews.text: I was really enjoying this stove at first. It pumped out the heat and had no problems cooking a 5 star meal. Then it happened. Poor construction popped it's head up and revealed the truth about this expensive and dangerous stove. Slacking integrity, my stove started leaking propane and could have had many bad endings if I wasn't OCD about cooking with propane. In the wrong hands this stove could have seriously injured someone. Definitely not worth $150 for 3 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob M.

customer_reviews.title: Worthwhile Investment
customer_reviews.text: Knew I was spending a bit more for "just a stove." However for those who plan on camping a long time, it is worth the investment. Having the electric ignition is convenient and safe. The higher burning BTU was great for a large group of impatient hungry campers. Solid build with good gauge of material. Only down side I had was the lack of carrying handle. They also provide parts list for the occasional mishap you might have.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: After having another stove for over a decade, we wore it the old one out with our numerous camping trips. Old one was another brand. I LOVE This New stove! This was now the 2nd time of using it for 3 meals a day for 3 days . Wind didn't blow it out and the bottom didn't get hot .. I Loved that I could adjust the heat level and it didn't go out! That was always an extreme issue with our other brand of camp stove. I am very pleased with this stove. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Mansfield

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but not quite right
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the grill, but mine came a little “tweaked” or twisted so doesn’t sit quite flat but does not impact use. It definitely drinks down the propane, but that is the price you pay for the high BTUs.
customer_reviews.author: GMC

customer_reviews.title: powerful burners
customer_reviews.text: I recently got this stove, and have taken it out twice. Time will tell, if it holds up. It's bigger and more powerful than my old Coleman. That being said it uses more fuel if you cook on high. So far I have no issues with it . It's sturdy and roomy enough for 2 large pots going at once. I have no problem with setting the burners on low, everything works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sands

customer_reviews.title: Great car camping stove.
customer_reviews.text: Have had Coleman 3 burner stoves for years, I was looking for something a little smaller with great heat output.. this fits the bill!! It’s build ok.. I don’t expect to get 30 years out of it but for the price it’s what I expected. It’s light and serve it’s purpose as a second/backup stove for car camping.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Rattletrap Gem of a stove!
customer_reviews.text: All the accolades written about this stove are true. The only negative I can offer is probably more about me than the stove. (read easily irritated grumpy old man). When packed, even in the optional carrying case, the stove rattles in the car, raft. Not loud but insistent. I've traded in cars for less, but I'll keep the stove!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce B Buckmaster

customer_reviews.title: Great Stove, Extreme Output
customer_reviews.text: This stove crushes the competition with pure heat output. Where it lacks is fine control of the heat. Low heat is hard to dial in. I finally got it and was able to fry a pound of bacon in the skillet without burning it to a crisp. For the larger pans you will have to drop a side to get it to fit. Had no problems with it for two camping trips. Works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Smoothbassman

customer_reviews.title: Great stove and has no problems at high elevations
customer_reviews.text: I live at 7500 feet and usually camp at 8000 feet or higher. I tested this at home just to make sure it survived shipping undamaged (it did) and used it for the first time to heat 1 quart of water for coffee. I was totally shocked to have the water at a full boil in under 5 minutes at about 8200 feet. Sweet! Burners do not adjust extremely low but I use a stove for heating water, cooking "boil-in-bag' meals, or making eggs/bacon/pancake type breakfasts or skillet fry dinners. It worked perfect for all of these. Stove is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Bad experience.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over the Eureka Ignite 2 plus, because of the mostly favorable reviews. DISCLAIMER, I did not actually fire it up because when I opened it from the box, the grate inside was pretty badly bent and would not allow a pot/pan to sit straight. I did not feel like bending the grate back into shape and just returned it. I'm not sure if this is a reflection on the MFR or the seller. Either way I was not happy to recieve the product unable to use out if the box.
customer_reviews.author: Brian E Mohn

customer_reviews.title: Should of bought one sooner
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. The Burners put out a truly massive amount of heat. It’s portable and ruggedly built. And the ignition is dead reliable. It also will boil water in a breeze. Realistically it’s better than my stove at home. Just buy one and go. For the reviews complaining about the heat adjustment. You adjust the knobs in small increments.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Great so far
customer_reviews.text: Great so far. It was top rated and it looks great. The griddle that fits this perfectly is the Lodge 20"x10.44" griddle.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I have received 1st one the left burner was loose, so I sent it back for another try. The replacement is not flat on bottom and this causes a catty corner wobble. This is unacceptable to me. I guess quality control in china is lacking. Anyway I will send this one back, maybe 3rd is the charm but I am not taking the chance.
customer_reviews.author: MCM1964

customer_reviews.title: needed for huricane cooking
customer_reviews.text: I live in Florida and huricanes can cause long periods of electrical outage. this will enable me to cook during these outages.
customer_reviews.author: qsrv400

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: I’d only give it 3 stars because of the hardware quality. The screws they use to keep this together are sub par and the two were snapped when it arrived so the burners were bouncing around inside. Thankfully nothing was damaged and I was able to replace them with better screws from my local hardware store. You could make the argument for shipping and handling error but the packaging arrived pristine and there was no other evidence of mishandling. The stove itself is great. The heat output is outstanding and it is very lightweight so if they were to complete the package and replace the garbage hardware this stove would be 5 stars for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holding up to the test of time.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stove. I've had it for 3 years now and have used it for car camping trips about 20 times now. It continues to hold up to the test of time. I have left it out in the weather elements for a weekend at a time and no issues at all. The only thing about this stove is that even on the lowest heat setting, it still pumps out some serious btu's. I use mainly cast iron by lodge when cooking, so I just turn off stove for a few minutes and let the retained cast iron heat continue to cook it. Plus side to that-I can boil water in 45 seconds!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey H.

customer_reviews.title: The front of the lid had a huge dent...
customer_reviews.text: ... but none of the packaging was damaged. That has to mean the huge dent came from the factory or someone else bought it, dented it, returned it and then Amazon just sold it to me like it was new. With the lid all dented, the wind screen won't lock into place. Other than this faux pa, the stove seems good.
customer_reviews.author: Bret

customer_reviews.title: Great Camp Stove
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful replacement for my old Coleman. Easy to control the heat level. Bigger flame source. Wish I had not spent time and money rebuilding the old stove
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne&Gil

customer_reviews.title: Love this camp stove
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly for us at camp! We previously had a very old Coleman camp stove (my Fathers in the 70's) that worked good but not great. Practicality after over or under cooking meals finally beat out sentimental value. We both love the ease of use, ease of temperature control and how easily this stove is to clean!
customer_reviews.author: Trish squires

customer_reviews.title: Best in class heat output
customer_reviews.text: We're buying these as replacements for our Scout Patrol kit stoves. We compared a bunch of different units that other outfits had and these were far and away the best. I recommend purchasing the adapter to use the refillable 20 LB propane tanks instead of using the single use throw away tanks it is designed to use. It's not like your taking this thing hiking and you'll save a bunch of money by not using disposable tanks, plus you're doing something nice for the environment.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great stove
customer_reviews.text: Just used this for the first time on a three week camping trip. It worked great, definitely can heat up water quick! We read lots of reviews on camping stoves before buying this one, and I am confident we picked right. It can put out lots of heat and the wind guards worked well. Good temperature control. Easy to light.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: First thing, this is big and it's heavy. It would have been much more useful if the company had included a briefcase handle on one side. It is amazing to cook on but it is big and it is heavy. My wife and I used it on our road trip of 5,943.2 miles around the country and it was awesome but it is BIG. I wish we'd gotten a smaller stove. It takes up a lot of space in the vehicle but it can heat stuff up in a hurry.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie V Bird

customer_reviews.title: camp stove review
customer_reviews.text: We bought it to prepare for the hurricane which thankfully missed us. However, it looked really well made and the set was very easy to assemble. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is because I haven't actually cooked with it. The price I paid is well worth the peace of mind I have knowing that no matter if it is a hurricane or a nor'eastern I will still have my hot cup of coffee in the AM.
customer_reviews.author: Judi A

customer_reviews.title: Great camping stove with lots of heat
customer_reviews.text: Great stove and does heat very well. My last stove was very old and did not cook well even on high. This stove puts out lots of heat. I had to learn to have it on low to cook my pancakes but once I had it right I was able to quickly feed my hungry teenagers. Heats great even using the second burner at the same time. Also it is very nice looking. I would recommend also purchasing the carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Moon

customer_reviews.title: This is better quality than the others. It works.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something besides my little Jetboil to cook my meals while camping. Don’t get me wrong. Those little stoves heat water quickly, but they can’t compete with a two burner stove. And this one is great. The flame goes up, not out, because it’s designed that way. It’s a better quality than the others and worth it. Now I’m a Culinary Genius!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Hoppe

customer_reviews.title: Sent it back - poor manufacturing quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this stove new to replace another well used propane stove and when it arrived, I opened and assembled only to find that the wind screen catch on the left side didn't line up with the lid catch. No way to fix this since it is welded. Poor manufacturing quality. Not impressed. I decided to do further research and purchased a different brand/model.
customer_reviews.author: LadyB

customer_reviews.title: I had an old Coleman which was fine, served us for many years
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this stove 10 stars I would. I had an old Coleman which was fine, served us for many years, but did not produce near the heat that this stove does. The design is great so I can get two nice sized pots on the stove, east start. My one complaint is shipping. The first one arrived too damaged to use and had to get a replacement. The second one also had two dents, but they didn't effect opening so I kept it. Still hate that I started out with dented product. Despite this, 5 stars because the product itself is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camping stove
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few Coleman stoves in my time, but when it came time to purchase a new stove; I decided to try this model from Camp Chef. I AM PLEASED WITH THIS MODEL! It's quiet, the temperature control can be fine tuned and its burners are big. As far as camping goes, this is one of my best investments. NO DOUBT!!!!
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Performs well, could use some improvement in valve control.
customer_reviews.text: Worked flawlessly during several excursions. Kicks up a powerful flame, though I wish there was a gas valve lockout on each knob. Probably fairly easy to leave open without realizing it. Something with a detent would work. It would be pretty easy to implement, just like a residential stove.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hanley

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I have used Coleman my whole life but have to admit I am converting. This unit look great and cooks great. Plenty of btu’s When you need them but will summer very well too. The only reason I gave it a 4 was the plastic lid closers. I have seen other people complain about this as it was recently changed. I do not know about them but charge me a few bucks more if I get metal.
customer_reviews.author: J W.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: I read great reviews of this stove, and really liked the size, and the BTUs. Unfortunately, the first one I received had a manufacturing defect -- the tab that holds one of the windscreens was installed too high, which was going to stress both the lid and the hinge of the windscreen. The second one had the same condition, although worse! Guess I'll try the Stansport.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin P. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Love this stove!
customer_reviews.text: We did a lot of research and this was highly recommended from reviewers. Took the stove for a 3 day camping trip and it exceeded our expectations. We cooked breakfast, lunch, and dinner on 2 propane tanks for the duration of the trip. You can adjust the temperature and it stays lit during windy conditions. I wish that it included a carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: HeartMyKids

customer_reviews.title: Great starter stove!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great introductory camp stove. Heat output was awesome. Doesn’t do super well on the lowest heat range - it’s still pretty hot on the lowest setting, so don’t expect to simmer anything. The handle situation leaves a lot to be desired. Clumsy and it’s hard to hold since the handle is a slot on one side. There are probably better stoves out there, but for the prices this one is really awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stein

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t seal from wind well. Doesn’t re-light from the push button until it cools down. Doesn’t hold a low simmer setting. Update: After 18 months of well maintained use, one of the burners smokes with a noxious metallic smell. Took it apart and cleaned it and still smokes when heated. I’m waiting to hear back from customer service even though it’s after the warranty period. Until then, I’m using my 30 year old Coleman that still works fine.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camp stove
customer_reviews.text: This highly rated stove deserves the high ratings and is easily worth the price. Admittedly my previous stove was an old Coleman white gas monster that was smelly and didn't ever get hot enough. This stove is easy to set up, has good wind protection and burns hot when needed. It is a little touchy getting it to cook at a very low simmer but it can be done with a little care. It can be attached to standard large propane tanks with an adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene DeMayo

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: The first use worked fine. 2nd time the automatic flame button no longer worked. I do not recommend this stove it was quite flimsy and at one point the top cover became jammed onto the bottom and I had to pry it open
customer_reviews.author: wanda

customer_reviews.title: MOSTLY great
customer_reviews.text: Durability and quality of flame are GREAT. But two small issues: don't know why it has to be so much thicker than similar, competing models... Camping car space is at a premium! Also, the igniter flame is so stiff, it's hard to press without sliding the whole stove across the table without holding it down with your other hand (and potentially burning because the side is hot!)
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Brennan Yeckley

customer_reviews.title: A serious camp stove
customer_reviews.text: Fired right up. Good heat. I placed a 12” cast iron skillet ( there’s room for two ) on it and fried a couple of ribeyes and then fried a mess of potatoes. Yumm. Time will tell how it holds up. I pleased so far👍
customer_reviews.author: Dorena Mountain Man

customer_reviews.title: Great Gas Stove
customer_reviews.text: Loved it. Ease to operate and heats up my iron skillet quick with no problems. Easy to assemble👍the only thing was When you turn it low, it doesn't go very low blue dim light low like my home stove. it will turn low but not super low. It's no big deal, I still love this stove. Highly recommend it. Been cooking on it twice a day for several months, love it👍
customer_reviews.author: VirginiaVans

customer_reviews.title: perfect camp stove!
customer_reviews.text: purchased this stove to use for overlanding/camping......couldn't be happier! used for the first time this weekend on a camping trip with my family and used it to cook every meal and 2 mornings worth of coffee! easy to clean, love the self lighting, and I wish the stove in my house boiled water as fast as this thing does! couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: don't burn your food, this is very hot !!!
customer_reviews.text: Camp chef.... Wow... this was on of the best purchases I ever made it works on the beach with constant wind, great light weight, easy set up, light enough to make pancakes on a cast iron pan and hot super hot to sear a steak, I can't wait to keep upgrading my outdoor kitchen with their products.
customer_reviews.author: walter Fuente

customer_reviews.title: Super high heat output
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. This is the second one I purchased. The first one was stolen. These make the Coleman stove look like play stoves. The heat output to boil water is better then my home stove. You will be happy with this stove.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Much sturdier and more professional
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something better than the merely adequate classic Coleman stove, and this one fits the bill. Much sturdier and more professional. While I don't see myself lugging this up to Mount Everest, it's a fun name that planted the seed of quality in my head.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Good all-around cooker
customer_reviews.text: Great burners, easy starting, easy clean-up. Only knocked down to 4 because they now use cheap plastic latches instead of the older metal ones. I would have been happy to pay a couple more dollars for metal latch(es) so I don't get the need to penny pinch on products such as this (but most companies seem to do it these days). Otherwise, Camp Chef is a great selection for campground cooking.
customer_reviews.author: P. Carpenter

product_meta.title: Camp Chef Everest 2 Burner Stove
product_meta.description:
Camp Chef: The Way to Cook Outdoors 
Don't be fooled by its size, the Everest 2 Burner Stove packs a lot of power under the hood. Two high-pressure 20,000 BTU burners pump out all the heat you'll need to handle your cooking needs and feed your family. A matchless ignition systems fires up the Everest quickly and easily. The nickel-coated steel cooking grate is strong and built to hold your pots, griddles, and skillets. Locking lid and handle allow the Mtn. Series to transport easily. Lightweight and compact means you can take it with you on all of your adventures.

Features

- Two 20,000 BTU burners 
- Three-sided wind barrier 
- Fully adjustable heat-control dials 
- Matchless ignition 
- Stainless steel drip tray for easy clean up 
- Powerful burners fight windy conditions 
- Emergency preparedness recommended 
- Convenient carry handle 
- Regulator adaptor for a 1-lb. propane cylinder include (can be adapted for use with standard bulk tanks using HRDSP)

Specifications

- Dimentions: 13.5" L x 23.5" W x 4" H 
- Total Output: 40,000 BTU/hr 
- Weight: 12 lbs. 
- Warranty: One Year



AMAZON.COM




Two high output propane burners put out a fierce 20,000 BTUs each. Somehow, food just tastes better in the great outdoors. It's with this in mind that Camp Chef created a wide-ranging line of camping cookware designed to combine the versatility and cook quality of patio grilling with the portability of traditional camp stoves.  The Everest Stove is built for maximum packability without sacrificing cooking performance. Its two high output burners put out 20,000 BTUs of heat each. Match-less ignition offers a convenient touch, and a stainless steel drip tray makes for easy cleanup. 

 When it's time to strike camp, the entire unit folds down to a compact size. The stove measures 23.5 by 4.25 by 13.5 inches (W x H x D), and was featured in the 2011 Woodall's Camping Life Gear Guide as one of the publication's recommended "things to get you started camping and having fun outdoors." 

 Warranty
Camp Chef stoves and grills include a limited one-year manufacturer's warranty against defects in materials and workmanship.
